title: Raceonsucced
author: Raceonsucced
content: there are many people investing in bitcoin, some are profitable and some are losing. and I believe bitcoin has a big advantage. The question is whether when you benefit from bitcoin, you can help your economy and your family?

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: Quote from: Raceonsucced on February 17, 2023, 12:45:45 AMthere are many people investing in bitcoin, some are profitable and some are losing. and I believe bitcoin has a big advantage. The question is whether when you benefit from bitcoin, you can help your economy and your family?Yes.Actually, it is not only me. Bitcoin and Stable coins are a big deal here in my country because inflation and lack of trust in our institutions. One just needs to take a look a countries like Nigeria or Argentina to see how Bitcoin can help people to face disadvantageous economical situations.For example, here in my country it was not possible to receive remittances directly from abroad, one needed the government as third party. In the end, they kept the USD and gave inflated local currency to the final recipient. Thanks to Bitcoin we can move money however we want without permission from autocrats.

comments.author: avikz
comments.body: Quote from: Raceonsucced on February 17, 2023, 12:45:45 AMthere are many people investing in bitcoin, some are profitable and some are losing. and I believe bitcoin has a big advantage. The question is whether when you benefit from bitcoin, you can help your economy and your family?Bitcoin or any other cryptos can surely help the economy by increasing the purchasing power of the people. Those who have invested in bitcoin and are currently in profit can surely use that extra money to buy things from their local market either by using bitcoin or by fiat after converting it. That's the only way bitcoin and other cryptos can help the economy. The other way to help is through taxes. There are a lot of people including me, who like to do the taxes diligently. So whatever extra earning they get from bitcoin, they calculate tax on it and pay to the government. That's another way but the numbers are insignificant.

comments.author: Solosanz
comments.body: Quote from: Raceonsucced on February 17, 2023, 12:45:45 AMThe question is whether when you benefit from bitcoin, you can help your economy and your family?It's a rhetorical question, similar like asking "if you make money, do you become poor?", "if you learn Bitcoin, do you understand about it?", "if you create a new account in this forum, do you have an account?" doesn't make sense at all, if you get profit it's obviously it will help your economy.To be honest any people who invest in Bitcoin aren't losing, most people are lost because they're trader and don't want to hold it at least for four years long.

comments.author: Swordsoffreedom
comments.body: Quote from: Raceonsucced on February 17, 2023, 12:45:45 AMThe question is whether when you benefit from bitcoin, you can help your economy and your family?Why not? Investing in bitcoin really helps me a lot economically. comments.body: Quote from: Raceonsucced The question is whether when you benefit from bitcoin, you can help your economy and your family?Yes, Bitcoin is really helping us in this inflation that is affecting many people in the country because they don't have knowledge on Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies that is making their businesses shaking in this period. I believe, i will be part of those that will smile soon when the price of Bitcoin hit $40,000, because I invested in Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies which all those coins will definitely increase higher before the half of this year 2023

comments.author: xSkylarx
comments.body: Once bitcoin can help you personally, it also has an effect on the economy, like when you have money to spend on goods that have VAT or a tax that can help improve your economy. Though most of us are just looking from our own perspective, we benefited from bitcoin. Yes, it really helps us financially as well as our family, and some of those who gain big profits build businesses that can also generate employment for others, which is good for the economy.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: If people make money over something â€” may it be through a business, job, or investments, it helps the economy simply because those people have more buying power. With more buying power, businesses flourish.

comments.author: Don Pedro Dinero
comments.body: Not really. There are a few places where you can pay in bitcoin, just as there are bitcoin ATMs and some cryptocurrency stores, but it is not part of everyday life. Some people are making money with it, but I doubt it accounts for a noticeable percentage of GDP. I guess from what I have seen that where it is most noticeable is in poor countries and countries with very high inflation in their national currency.

comments.body: The aspect of Bitcoin helping people or family is not just that easy as people have said it. There are different ways to make money from bitcoin like I can mention mining, hodling or trading bitcoin to say just these. But apart from trading, hodling of bitcoin can not feed a family because it is seasonal, it is only trading bitcoin that you can benefit but this also is not easy. We still don't need to put our eyes in one basket, we still need to do other businesses to support on bitcoin endeavour and trading.

comments.author: Getmon
comments.body: No, and yes. Those who have made profits from their bitcoin investments and converted their bitcoins into fiat indicate that they have already made a contribution to their family and economy. No, when an individual converts his or her bitcoin into fiat at a loss.Anyhow, let us talk about bitcoin in a broader context. One of the reasons why the value of Bitcoin has continued to rise since its inception is that there is a finite supply of it. Because it is a borderless currency, Bitcoin makes it possible for individuals to transfer money from different parts of the world without paying high transaction fees and third-party systems. We live in a digital age, and bitcoin is an improved version of our common currency.
